alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; New Kent (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 16 at 8:35AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...AREAS OF FREEZING DRIZZLE AND FREEZING FOG ACROSS EAST-CENTRAL VIRGINIA... Areas of freezing drizzle and freezing fog are occurring this morning across east-central Virginia. This could result in some light icing, primarily on elevated surfaces, and secondary roads, and bridges and overpasses. Visibility will generally range from one half to one mile, but will occasionally be reduced to one quarter mile. Visibility should improve, and freezing drizzle should dissipate after 10 AM. Motorists should be alert for sudden changes in visibility due to the areas of fog, and remain alert for icy patches. Drive at reduced speeds and use low beam headlights only.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; New Kent
